summary: Build FOSCO: a web app for real-time video calling (via webcam/mic) while co-watching by screen casting, with phone-number-based sign-in and a UI that keeps a small video-call window in the bottom-left over a larger movie/screen-cast window.
architectural_notes: Use real-time browser media (webcam/mic) for video calls (e.g., WebRTC).
Use browser screen-capture for screen casting (e.g., getDisplayMedia) with single-caster enforcement.

existing_features.title: Implement a required sign-in flow using Internet Identity, followed by a required profile step that collects and stores the user’s phone number (as plain text) before allowing access to calling/screen-casting features.

Implement WebRTC 1:1 video/audio calling in the frontend using the user’s webcam and microphone, including permission prompts and local preview, and connect peers using canister-mediated signaling (offer/answer/ICE exchange).
Add outgoing call UX: a phone-number input field to initiate a call to another signed-in user, and an in-call control set (at minimum: end call; optionally: mute mic / disable camera).
Add incoming call UX inside the facetime window: show an “Incoming call” state with Answer/Decline controls, and only establish the WebRTC connection when the user answers.

Implement the main viewing layout: a large “movie/screen-cast” area and a small facetime window anchored to the bottom-left as an overlay; the facetime window must be the smallest window on screen during normal viewing.

Add screen-casting (screen share) capability: allow a user in a call to share their screen and render the shared stream in the large movie window for both users; allow stopping screen share to return to the default state.

Enforce “only one active screen cast at a time” per call session via backend session state: when one participant is currently sharing, attempts by the other participant to start screen share are rejected with an English reminder message.
Add fullscreen mode for the movie/screen-cast window; when fullscreen is enabled, keep the facetime window visible at bottom-left and reduce its size compared to non-fullscreen mode.

Create a coherent visual theme for FOSCO and apply it consistently across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a “co-watching + calling” product; avoid default-looking styling.

new_feature_requests.summary: Phone-number-based sign-in required to use the site
Call other signed-in users by entering their phone number
Incoming call UI with ability to answer from the facetime window
Request and use webcam + microphone permissions for live video/audio calls
UI layout with small facetime window anchored bottom-left and a larger movie/screen-cast window
Screen-cast to the movie window so the other caller can see the caster’s screen
Allow only one active screen cast at a time; show error/reminder if both try to cast simultaneously
Fullscreen mode for the movie window while keeping a smaller bottom-left facetime overlay

Create backend data structures and APIs to register signed-in users as available (presence), map phone numbers to user principals, and allow lookup of a target user principal by phone number for calling.
